TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit BitmapFrame extends System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource implements class System.Windows.Markup.IUriContext

Docs.summary: Represents image data returned by a decoder and accepted by encoders.

remarks.format:
## Remarks <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame> provides additional functionality not defined by <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource> by providing access to the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame.Thumbnail%2A> associated with a particular frame of an image. <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame> also supports the writing of metadata information by using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.Metadata%2A> property or the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame.CreateInPlaceBitmapMetadataWriter%2A> method.
Any <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame> returned from a decoder is always frozen. If you require a modifiable copy, you must first create a copy of the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame> by using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.Clone%2A> method.
Only [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_tiff](~/includes/tlasharptla-tiff-md.md)] and [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_gif](~/includes/tlasharptla-gif-md.md)] format images support multiple frames.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to create a new <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource> by using a <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame>.
[!code-csharp[bitmapframeexample#1](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BitmapFrameExample/CSharp/BitmapFrame.cs#1)] [!code-vb[bitmapframeexample#1](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BitmapFrameExample/VB/BitmapFrame.vb#1)]
The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame> object to open a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_png](~/includes/tlasharptla-png-md.md)] graphic and write metadata by using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame.CreateInPlaceBitmapMetadataWriter%2A> method.
[!code-cpp[bitmapmetadata#SetQuery](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BitMapMetadata/CPP/BitmapMetadata.cpp#setquery)] [!code-csharp[bitmapmetadata#SetQuery](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BitMapMetadata/CSharp/BitmapMetadata.cs#setquery)] [!code-vb[bitmapmetadata#SetQuery](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BitMapMetadata/VB/BitmapMetadata.vb#setquery)]

MemberSignature.Value: public static System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame Create (System.IO.Stream bitmapStream);
.method public static hidebysig class System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame Create(class System.IO.Stream bitmapStream) cil managed

Docs.param: The that is used to construct the .
Docs.summary: Creates a new from a given .

remarks.format: ## Remarks The `bitmapStream` can be closed after the frame is created only when the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption.OnLoad> cache option is used. The default <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption.OnDemand> cache option retains the stream until the frame is needed. Use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame.Create%28System.IO.Stream%2CSystem.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCreateOptions%2CSystem.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption%29> method to specify create and cache options.

remarks.format: ## Remarks Use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption.OnLoad> cache option if you wish to close the `bitmapStream` after the bitmap is created. The default <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapCacheOption.OnDemand> cache option retains access to the stream until the bitmap is needed and cleanup is handled by the garbage collector.

MemberSignature.Value: public abstract System.Windows.Media.Imaging.InPlaceBitmapMetadataWriter CreateInPlaceBitmapMetadataWriter ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Windows.Media.Imaging.InPlaceBitmapMetadataWriter CreateInPlaceBitmapMetadataWriter() cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, creates an instance of , which can be used to associate metadata with a .

remarks.format:
## Remarks Metadata can only be added or edited using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame.CreateInPlaceBitmapMetadataWriter%2A> if the image file contains enough room for the new metadata; otherwise, metadata can be added using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapSource.Metadata%2A> property.
## Examples The following code example demonstrates how to use the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame> object to open a [!INCLUDE[TLA#tla_png](~/includes/tlasharptla-png-md.md)] graphic and write metadata by using the <xref:System.Windows.Media.Imaging.BitmapFrame.CreateInPlaceBitmapMetadataWriter%2A> method.
[!code-cpp[bitmapmetadata#SetQuery](~/samples/snippets/cpp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BitMapMetadata/CPP/BitmapMetadata.cpp#setquery)] [!code-csharp[bitmapmetadata#SetQuery](~/samples/snippets/csharp/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BitMapMetadata/CSharp/BitmapMetadata.cs#setquery)] [!code-vb[bitmapmetadata#SetQuery](~/samples/snippets/visualbasic/VS_Snippets_Wpf/BitMapMetadata/VB/BitmapMetadata.vb#setquery)]
